title: Addfoto.com logo
content:
hi,   
   
addfoto.com will be a photographers gallery + stock photo + photography theory & tutorials project. The concept off ADD something made me use the universal (+) symbol that will be the visual brand of the site & logo. For now, the colors are not final, and I'm quite happy with the results. The card is of course not final, just to show the (+) cut I want to use on this ID.   
   
I want a strong ID, very simple and easy recognizable (memorable).   
   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526120955im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/24703.gif)   
   
Thanks for all the feedback.   
adriano
author: adriano

comments.content:
What about using the plus sign as a camera cross-hairs, like on one of the "oh"s?   
   
hhp

Gosh�with the "F" the "T" and Hrant's "O"s suggestion, I can see a myriad of ways to incorporate the "+". Is it safe to assume that you have explored incorporating the "+" into each of these letterforms in several ways? Your current design is nice, but it isn't captivating, and IMHO if you're going for "very simple"�I think this is the most complicated concept of all the ones I can visualize.   
   
I like the die cut, but do you think it might be more practical to design the card around a die cut on one of the top corners instead? Reason being that a lot of bizcard storage products (i.e. rolodex) hold cards at the bottom corners. Then again, I guess the card could be stored upside down.   
   
I'm interested to see where this ends up. It's a great start.   
   
Aloha!   
Scott
Hrant that would be a good idea, and Charleston Heston would indorse it especially if you had a deer image behind the cross hairs.

Would you use the +F as a gestalt? It may suggest F+, as in failing plus. I like your approach though.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526120955im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/24716.jpg)

Thanks for your comments. I won't use F+ as a gestalt, the +FOTO will be always as one. I will use the (+) as the gestalt.   
   
About the bottom corners, you are right, I did this so fast as the idea was good that I really need to put the stuff on illustrator. I think Daniel is correct on the cross hairs... I have to think anf try a bit more.

I love that logo. Simply I love it. the + may get lost as you pullaway though. I dont know how it'll look on a pen ( Micro size ) or on other color backgrounds. If its pure white it works. ButLittle Gettyimages with a color scheme if your going for a new brand. hmmm... play with it in other colors see how it works other flat colors.   
   
Love the communication though, elegant simple brings addition to photography with a corporate functional voice.

I really like the concept.   
I think it is fairly solid.   
   
Hildebrant.

This will be my project for the next 3 months, so I'll pick this ID in a few weeks. Thanks for the feedback ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526120955im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
